references.paper_title: Action genome: Actions as compositions of spatio-temporal scene graphs
references.reason: This paper is foundational for video scene graph generation (VidSGG), introducing a new dataset that emphasizes dynamic interactions and serving as a benchmark for subsequent VidSGG research.

This paper introduces a significant benchmark dataset (PVSG) for VidSGG, pushing the field toward higher-quality scene graph generation by using panoptic annotations to capture both object instances and their relationships comprehensively.

references.paper_title: HIG: Hierarchical interlacement graph approach to scene graph generation in video understanding
references.reason: This paper proposes a novel hierarchical graph approach for VidSGG, improving the ability of models to capture long-range temporal dependencies and complex object interactions.

references.paper_title: P2t: Pyramid pooling transformer for scene understanding
references.reason: This paper introduces a pyramid pooling transformer architecture for scene understanding, advancing the field by employing a novel attention mechanism to capture relationships between objects effectively.

This paper is a foundational work in end-to-end object detection, introducing the DETR framework which uses transformers to process object queries and keys, facilitating the development of more sophisticated object relationship modeling methods.
